rows.TUP LIFECYCLE PHASES: Every TUP moves through these phases. The phases are THE integration layer between imagination and implementation.
The imagination phase and the implementation phase feel disconnected from individual TUPs.
A TUP isn't just 'imagination' or 'implementation' — it moves through a lifecycle WITH phases.
This tab makes every TUP's current phase explicit and defines what happens at each transition.

rows.col_4: Thesis commits TUP to existence. Scope defined. Tab structure designed. Initial content spec written. This is where TUP gets its P-tab (project plan) and skeleton.
rows.col_5: P-tab exists with scope, win conditions, tab list, dependencies, and assigned cluster

rows.col_4: AI production loop: prompt Claude with P-tab spec, review output, iterate. Content tabs get filled. This is the 'textbook writing' phase. Solo work — one person + AI.
rows.col_5: All content tabs have first-draft content. Librarian confirms completeness against P-tab spec.

rows.col_4: Librarian checks: do all tabs match P-tab spec? Are dependencies to other TUPs consistent? Are terms in Conceptual Index? Conductor checks: is this TUP blocking other clusters?
rows.col_5: Librarian signs off on structural completeness. No broken cross-references.
rows.col_6: Updated V-tab with internal review notes

rows.col_4: Domain expert grades the TUP using Course Template grading rubric. ACP criteria: Attestation (is it true?), Completeness (everything there?), Plausibility (could it work?). Expert doesn't need to understand the whole Trade — just their domain.
rows.col_5: Expert grade recorded. If B or above: TUP locks (imagination complete). If C or below: remediation loop.
rows.col_6: Expert grade, review notes, V-tab updated

rows.col_4: TUP content tabs become read-only in imagination passet. Grade is final. TUP is now a 'textbook chapter' — reference material for implementation. Any changes require formal amendment (new version, re-grade).
rows.col_5: Lock is automatic on grade ≥ B. Librarian confirms lock.

rows.col_4: Implementation passet receives task extraction from this TUP. 'Here's the textbook chapter on media buying — here are the 47 tasks to actually do media buying.' Time-bound, role-assigned, dependency-mapped.
rows.col_5: Implementation TUP created in File 2 with all tasks, owners, deadlines, dependencies.

rows.col_4: Real-world execution against the plan. Buying ads, signing contracts, ordering inventory. Progress tracked in implementation passet. Issues that reveal imagination gaps get flagged.
rows.col_5: All tasks complete OR kill criteria triggered.
rows.col_6: Completed tasks, execution log, issue flags

rows.col_4: What worked? What didn't? What should change in the imagination passet for next time? Lessons flow back into templates and playbooks. If imagination gap found, TUP gets amendment.
rows.col_5: Post-mortem filed. Template updates proposed. Lessons captured.

rows.TUP LIFECYCLE PHASES: HOW THIS CONNECTS TO THE TWO-PASSET MODEL
Phases 0-4 happen in the IMAGINATION PASSET (this file). The TUP is being designed.
Phases 5-7 happen in the IMPLEMENTATION PASSET (File 2). The TUP is being executed.
Phase 4 (Lock) is the bridge. Once locked, imagination content becomes read-only reference for implementation.
The imagination passet LOCKS when graded. The implementation passet STAYS ALIVE until execution completes.
[All other TUPs: Phase 0 — awaiting M0 thesis]
